was put in charge of the project. Do you know what he did?
No, Mr* Warden.
He took with him exactly one hundred convicts from Auburn, set
them up hers in a camp; a work camp; a silent work camp*
Work and silence.
Exactly. Those convicts themselves built the first cell-block at Sing-
Sing. They worked unmanacled, and almost unguarded; at night, they
slept in tents. And none tried to escape; not one!
Incredible!
It created a sensation.
But was this due to the personality of Elam Lynds?
